thread.title: India vs South Africa 3rd ODI Toss Report & Playing XI: SA win toss; elect to bat vs IND
thread.title_full: India vs South Africa 3rd ODI Toss Report & Playing XI: SA win toss; elect to bat vs IND

author: Aayush Puthran | India.com Sports Desk
title: India vs South Africa 3rd ODI Toss Report & Playing XI: SA win toss; elect to bat vs IND
text:
India vs South Africa 3rd ODI Toss Report & Playing XI: SA win toss; elect to bat vs IND By India.com Sports Desk on October 18, 2015 at 1:03 PM Comments South Africa skipper AB de Villiers won the toss and elected to bat against India in the third One-Day International (ODI) at the Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Rajkot on Sunday. Both skippers – MS Dhoni and AB de Villiers have announced the Playing XI of India and South Africa respectively. South Africa have gone in with an unchanged side while India have made one change. Amit Mishra has come in for Umesh Yadav.The India vs South South Africa match is set to start at 01:30 PM Indian Standard Time (IST). (Also Watch: India vs South Africa 3 rd ODI Free Livce Streaming h ere ) MS Dhoni led India to a 22-run win at Indore with an unbeaten 92 in the second ODI. The Paytm Friendship series is now levelled at 1-1 with three more matches to go. It was the first defeat for South Africa on the tour. Their batting order, which so far looked good, crumbled against Indian spinners. With a flat pitch on offer, a high-scoring encounter is on cards. (Also Catch: India vs South Africa 3 rd ODI Live Scorecard and Ball by Ball Commentary here ) MS Dhoni, returning to form has been a good news for India. However, the regularity with which Indian top-order batsmen are getting run-out is a cause of worry. (Also Watch: India vs South Africa, 3rd ODI Preview here ) Kagiso Rabada has gelled well alongside Dale Steyn and Morne Morkel. However, it is their fifth bowling option which hasn’t given them the desired result. JP Duminy and Farhaan Behardien have been highly ineffective against Indian batsmen. (Also Catch: India vs South Africa 3 rd ODI Live Score Updates here ) India ODI Playing XI: MS Dhoni (C), Virat Kohli, Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Suresh Raina, Ajinkya Rahane, Axar Patel, Amit Mishra, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohit Sharma South Africa Playing XI: AB De Villiers (C), Hashim Amla, Quinton de Kock, Faf Du Plessis, JP Duminy, David Miller, Farhaan Behardien, Imran Tahir, Dale Steyn, Morne Morkel, Kagiso Rabada.
